channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bayer CEO Bill Anderson’s war against bureaucracy
item.description: Also: Tesla shares fall as Q1 worries accrue, Jamie Dimon apologizes for cursing, not for DEI.

item.title: Talks on Syria’s Future Fall Short of Promises, Participants Say
item.description: The country’s new leaders had billed a two-day “national dialogue” in Damascus as the start of a process to build an inclusive government. But some wh...

item.title: Tim Cook says Apple may have to change some DEI initiatives to comply with the Trump administration—as shareholders vote to retain them
item.description: Apple is fighting for DEI as its Big Tech peers pull back diversity initiatives.

item.title: Swatch became the elite Swiss watch industry’s crusader by making colorful plastic timepieces. Now it’ll have to prove itself once again
item.description: Swatch Group catapulted to fame with its motley of colorful plastic watches, credited with saving the entire Swiss watch industry. It’s since seen suc...

item.title: BP to ‘Fundamentally Reset’ Strategy in Shift Back to Oil and Gas
item.description: The energy giant said it would cut planned investments in clean energy and redirect spending toward fossil fuels.

item.title: The Dramatic House Budget Vote, and a New ‘Gold Card’ for Immigrants
It’s 5 minutes to midnight for Germany’s economy, Bundesbank chief warns after central bank’s first loss in 45 years
item.description: The Bundesbank racked up its first loss since 1979, as president Joachim Nagel called on Germany's incoming government to save the economy.

item.title: Father-son feud and an alleged ‘attempted coup’ rock one of Singapore’s largest property developers
item.description: Kwek Leng Beng, the chairman of City Developments Limited, is accusing his son Sherman Kwek, who is the CEO, of "serious lapses of corporate governanc...

item.title: One Nation, Under God
item.description: Americans have stopped leaving Christianity. And the country is overwhelmingly spiritual, a new report found.

item.title: Israel and Hamas Agree Another Hostage Release and Prisoner Exchange
item.description: The remains of four Israeli hostages will be turned over in exchange for hundreds of Palestinian prisoners whose release had been delayed.

item.title: Wildfire Burning on Table Mountain Moves Toward Cape Town
item.description: Firefighters have battled a blaze on the slopes in the national park for days. The fire spread overnight toward Cape Town’s central business district.

item.title: Christianity’s Decline in U.S. Appears to Have Halted, Major Study Shows
item.description: Young people contributed to the shift. “If you’re a young white male these days and you think of yourself as conservative, then being religious is a p...

item.title: Rejecting Trump’s Call to Annex Their Nation, Canadians Rally Around the Flag
item.description: While Canadians are not generally known for flag waving, President Trump’s threats have led to a surge in flag sales and buffed up the national symbol...

item.title: South Koreans Are Having More Babies After Years of Decline
item.description: South Korea reported a rare increase in births last year as the country grapples with a dwindling population. Its fertility rate remains the world’s l...

item.title: Talks on Syria’s Future Fall Short of Promises, Participants Say
